productData.title: Suncast 33 Gallon Hideaway Can Resin Outdoor Trash with Lid Use in Backyard, Deck, or Patio, 33-Gallon, Brown
features: OUTDOOR PATIO TRASH CAN: Features a decorative wicker-style design for a stylish addition to your outdoor space
FUNCTIONAL DESIGN: Lid is hinged for easy access and latches securely so garbage stays in the can
CONVENIENT USE: Compatible with standard 30 gal. garbage bags for easy and convenient use
DURABLE CONSTRUCTION: Constructed with durable resin that resists fading and keeps water out through every season
COMPACT SIZE: Measures 16" x 15.75" x 31.7" to keep your porch clean without taking up too much space Coverage Area (sq. ft.): 1.75 ft²

productDetails.Item model number: 33 Gallon Hideaway Trash Can for Patio -

productData.productDescription: Keep unsightly garbage out of view with the Suncast 33 Gallon Resin Outdoor Hideaway Patio Trash Can. This patio trash can features a decorative wicker-style design for a stylish addition to your outdoor space. The decorative and functional waste bin is compatible with standard 30 gal. garbage bags for easy and convenient use. This trash can also features a secure latching design to help keep trash in and critters out. Constructed from durable resin that resists fading, this trash can is built to bring provide long-lasting use on your porch or patio. The Suncast 30 Gallon Resin Outdoor Hideaway Patio Trash Can measures 16" x 15.75" x 31.7" to keep your porch clean without taking up too much space. Suncast takes pride in helping customers enhance their indoor and outdoor spaces with quality products that are stylishly designed. You take pride in creating a beautiful environment. We take pride in keeping it that way.

topReviews.text: My dog poops roughly 8 times a day.  I needed a place to store this poop that wasn't inside my house or inside the garbage cans i keep in the garage.  This thing sits on my patio and stores my dog poop until garbage day.  It contains the smell; there is no odor around or near it.  Of course, when you open it up, it smells like dog poop, but how are you going to stop that.  It has like a double lid thing going on which is nice.  The main opening allows me to put garbage bags in and take them out and also keeps them securely in place.  The smaller lid opens up allowing me to dump dog poop straight from the pooper scooper without messing with the bag or worrying about getting my hands dirty.  Also, I have had this thing sitting in the sun for more than a year now and it has held its original color.  I expected it to fade, but so far, so good.
topReviews.title: The classiest way to store dog poop in open sight.

topReviews.text: These are very sturdy and only took a minute to snap together.  I can't say how well they hold up outside, but the quality is far better than I expected for the price.  I actually bought these as a creative way to sort laundry.  I purchased three of these trash hideaways and some cloth liners off Amazon for $7.  I snap the liners in the lid so that the weight of my husband's jeans don't make the liner fall into the bin.  The top opening hatch is perfect for my kids to use, as it keeps everything in place during their clumsy sorting.  I no longer have to fish out the edges of the hamper lining under a bunch of dirty underwear. Yay!!! That makes this a perfect design for a laundry hamper for any mom (especially with little bed wetters).  Standard laundry hampers don't have this feature because they are not built this way.  And with stylish design, no one even knows that these are actually trash bins!  Everyone who has seen them love them!  This idea is cheaper than most "sturdy" full sized laundry hampers and waaaay better because of being able to snap in the he liner and only pull it out when full, but still having access to put clothes in with the use of the top hatch.  It's brilliant.  I used my label makers and made simple labels for darks, whites, and colors.  If your kids can't read yet, perhaps order different colored liners or tape to distinguish each hamper for easy sorting.
topReviews.title: Makes the BEST laundry hampers!!!!! Read why

topReviews.text: Ok I've has this trash can for a couple of months now. I wanted to live with it before I reviewed it. I have this inside, in the kitchen, because it does look that nice, and I like a big trash can that I don't have to empty every 2 days. I love the overall look, the way the lid holds the bag in place, the way the lid locks if you need it. Now this is what I HATE....when I take the full bag out, it's a struggle, and the bag usually rips because the inside is not smooth, it has ridges made into the resin that catch the full bag and rip it as you pull. If they could make the inside smooth, this would be the absolutely perfect trash can. And I know, you could put less trash in it so the bag wouldn't be so full and push against the inside as you try to take it out.....but that kind of defeats the purpose of having a large trash can, doesn't it? You use a large trash can because you want it to hold a lot of trash so you have to empty it less often and use fewer bags. I do have an idea on how to fix this, and I'll be trying it out probably in the next few days. I'm either going to cut 4 pieces of either cardboard or flat plastic, and tape it to the 4 inside walls to make them smooth. It won't change the capacity, and it should make the shredded bag problem go away. But should I have to do this, or should it just be made that way? With just a little more real world testing, it should have been obvious to the company that it tears the bags when the bag is full. Oh well, nothing is perfect.......UPDATE 5/20/14......I have fixed the inside of the trash can so it no longer rips the bags! Here's what you do. I went to wally world, and got a cardboard box, it's in the packing supply section. The size you need is 14 by 14 by 14, it comes folded flat, it's 68 cents. When you open it, it fits almost perfectly down into the inside of the trash can. You do have to wiggle it a bit, as it's not quite exactly the same size, but it fits great when you get it all the way in. Then just trim the top of the box so it's just inside the lid so it will close, and there you go, the bags just slide right out, no matter how full! You're welcome lol!!
topReviews.title: UPDATE-a fix for the bag ripping problem!

topReviews.text: I have read that many customers complain about the bag ripping when removing it from the bin.  We purchase 33 gallon bags from Amazon, with the description provided below.  Not once have these bags ripped while being removed from this bin.  While these bags do not come with the convenient drawstrings, they do have twist ties.  They are very thick, and we paid about $23.00 for 100 bags.  I believe the tearing occurs when the bag is very full or contains sharp objects, or at least that has been my experience.  We have never had one of these very thick 33 gallon bags rip while removing it from the bin.  This is the description of the bags we purchased from Amazon which, for us, is nearly a on year supply:  https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B077SQHBTW/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=  If the link doesn't work this is the description:  Trash Bags 33 Gallon, Large Black Garbage Bags, 100/Count, 33"W x 39"H, (Black)  The cost is $22.95 for 100 bags.The photo I have posted, taken today, is of a 5 year, 4 month old Suncast Outdoor Trash Hideaway, which I purchased from Amazon in April, 2013.  Since that time the bin has been sitting on my covered patio in an area that faces the morning sun until at least 11:00 to noon during the long summer months, with temperatures of 90-100 degrees, or higher.  Our town requires that all trash be bagged, so we put a 33 gallon trash bag in the bin.  Each day we empty the trash bins from the house into the bag in the Suncast bin.  When the trash bag is full we take it out to the large containers provided by the town that are stored behind our house, usually twice a week.  I am writing this review now because we recently purchased a 2nd Suncast bin when we found that they also come in a lighter (beige?) color, which matches the patio colors, block wall, etc., and blends in better than the dark brown.  HOWEVER, our more than 5 year old Suncast bin is STILL in nearly perfect condition.  The photo shows that it is kind of dirty/dusty right now because we have had several monsoon dust storms in the last few days, but we normally hose it off once a week and it cleans up like new.  It is also almost waterproof.  It can be hosed off without water getting into the trash bag.  When we have had severe storms where the rain has come down very hard and sideways there have been a couple of times where a little water got into the bag in the bin.  The ONLY thing wrong with this bin, which was my fault, is that the plastic/rubber hinges partially broke when I knocked it over while the cover was open.  However, it has in no way affected the way it seals the top.  While I normally would not write a long review about a product designed to hold trash, I do feel that the quality and design of this product at such a reasonable price deserves to be acknowledged.  Because the top provides a pretty good seal we can have the bin near our back door without attracting dozens of flies.  We will use the old bin, which will fit neatly into a garage corner,  for storing smaller garden items-trimmers, small shovels, etc.  I believe this  product will be around long after we're gone :)
topReviews.title: The photo is of a 5 year old that trash bin that has survived Arizona sun!  Addendum to this review

topReviews.text: We've had this trash hideaway for a couple of months.  I waited to be sure how things would work before posting a review.Pros:- We like the design and look for use on our patio.  For the price, it is fine and much like we anticipated.- The latching feature is functional and needed for our use.- It was easy to assemble and the resin construction should hold up well outside.Cons:- The trash bag will rip ... plain and simple.  I read the other reviews before ordering and thought we'll just be careful.  If you are actually putting trash into this container (duh), it is going to expand enough that the inside ribs will catch it and tear it.  I had read Marty B's review about using a 14x14x14 carboard box as a liner.  Bought one at our local blue discount store for cheap, but really?!?!?  There is no way I can give more than one star when a manufacturer ignores so many complaints about a design defect.  Heck, if they don't want to redesign, they could add a fold-out plastic liner to insert after assembly.
topReviews.title: So Aggravating - Design Defect

topReviews.text: I love these storage containers. I have purchased 3 sets of them (6) over the past 2 years. I have 2 by our pool - 1 for trash & 1 for cans/bottles. They stay closed nicely so even if the dog finds a way to tip it over he can't get in it and spread garbage. Two others we use to sort recycles (glass, cans, plastics) for our association at our summer condo. The last set I gave to some friends for their man-cave. They love them! They are very attractive, large and well worth the price! I made signs and laminated them for inside the lids to indicate what goes in them. They stay very dry.
topReviews.title: If you are in need of an attractive, large sturdy trash container - this is it!

topReviews.text: I like the size of the container.  I just naturally assumed when I snapped it together that the top would stay closed, not really an above-and-beyond expectation!  When fully assembled the top had to be slammed down to the closed position, but then would pop back up.  I had to fabricate a latch which would hold it closed - not something covered in the ’scarce’ instructions. I only kept it because it is the size I need, but found after several uses that the inside walls were not smooth and I could not extract a full plastic bag liner.  This is the WORST item I have ever purchased from Amazon.  I want my money back!
topReviews.title: Top won’t stay closed and not functional

topReviews.text: Yes it's plastic... But does the job. Very easy to put together too. Took about 15 minutes. I bought an entire Corfu set ( 2 chairs/1 sofa, table) including this trash can, and cooler-table. Looks great on my tiny deck ... No it not wicker but can not beat the price and just as comfy.
topReviews.title: Looks nice

topReviews.text: Trash bag rips every time I take the trash bag out it hooks on the sharp plastic inside and puts a rip/tear/hole in my trash bag every time. I’ve even went as far as not filling the trash bag up so much thinking maybe it would not catch on the plastic inside but it still did. So if you don’t mind picking trash up every time you change the bag in the can then go ahead and get one but if you don’t want to pick your trash up u already threw away then don’t waste your money on this trash can. The only thing good about this can is it’s cute that’s it
topReviews.title: Don’t waste your money unless you like picking trash up you already threw away again

topReviews.text: Esthetically this Trash Can looks great! That's where it ends! The pre-fabrication methods used in the trash can I have leaves multiple plastic sharp edges on the inside that don't extend down to the next section.Every bag is ripped when lifting the bag out. We've resorted to using duct tape in several areas to ensure the least amount of rips.  In other areas,  I've cut pieces of cardboard and hot-glued them.As I said, looks great, but wouldn't buy again. Very disappointed.
topReviews.title: Every bag is ripped from 1-3 mil thickness

customerImages.text: These are very sturdy and only took a minute to snap together.  I can't say how well they hold up outside, but the quality is far better than I expected for the price.  I actually bought these as a creative way to sort laundry.  I purchased three of these trash hideaways and some cloth liners off Amazon for $7.  I snap the liners in the lid so that the weight of my husband's jeans don't make the liner fall into the bin.  The top opening hatch is perfect for my kids to use, as it keeps everything in place during their clumsy sorting.  I no longer have to fish out the edges of the hamper lining under a bunch of dirty underwear. Yay!!! That makes this a perfect design for a laundry hamper for any mom (especially with little bed wetters).  Standard laundry hampers don't have this feature because they are not built this way.  And with stylish design, no one even knows that these are actually trash bins!  Everyone who has seen them love them!  This idea is cheaper than most "sturdy" full sized laundry hampers and waaaay better because of being able to snap in the he liner and only pull it out when full, but still having access to put clothes in with the use of the top hatch.  It's brilliant.  I used my label makers and made simple labels for darks, whites, and colors.  If your kids can't read yet, perhaps order different colored liners or tape to distinguish each hamper for easy sorting.
customerImages.title: Makes the BEST laundry hampers!!!!! Read why

customerImages.text:
I think most people expressed their general enthusiasm about the item and I only can join the happy choir as it is truly great item. I ordered two of them and they are keepers. I wanted to share with you
something that others seems to omit and those are the things I wish I knew while searching for it
as they would help me to make the right decision so here they are:

COLOR BEWARE!!!! or rejoice!

I ordered brown and I was really hoping to get that dark deep brown that is posted but you know how it is with ordering online. Sometimes the color is way off. So this time, it was total delight. I am so happy.
When I opened the box and I saw the exact color I wished for I was so happy. I posted the color I ordered along with my review so you can see which one on the amazon website I ordered and so you know that this is the exact color that they shipped.

BACK VIEW..
I saw the same brand making similar container that has bit differnt patter, more of a planks then wicker and frankly I like it better but could not find it anywhere. So I picked this one instead with lower part plank like pattern and the upper part the wicker pattern.

To my surprise the back side is all plank! So if I want I can keep them that way for the look I prefer,
all planks... look. This require to turn the bin backwards so the flap will not open when you approach it
so if this does not bother you and you can do bit of a extra lift then you can get that look too..
just by turning the bean back to front... no, you can not flip the sides while you putting it together
because the sides are not interchangeable. Their position is set. But this is really great news for me.

LOCK!

that they don't tell you about! Yes it comes with a lock! It is a little slide type of thing
that the top comes with and so once you lift the top, place your stuff inside and then close it,
just by the same movement almost you can lock it... as ll you have to do is slide down or up
the handle you use to lift it and that way it is locked or opened, YOU can keep it either all locked or all open it does not lock by itself. This is nifty to protect from smart racoons or kids.

IT DOES NOT COME ASSAMBLED BUT YOU SNAP THE 6 PIECES IN PLACE IN 3 MINUTES. NO TOOLS.

I was bit concerned when it come in a flat box I went.. oh.. oh..
As I know putting together some plastic containers may require screws and lots of gymnastics, I am not happy to do that.
So this was a relief to see that NO TOOLS are required, NONE whatsoever.
It snaps snap snap and done..

I had to do it twice since I bought two containers that I need for two places so it was fun to learn
on the first one and then use the skills on the second one.

MY TIPS FOR SNAPPING SIDES:
- don't attempt to do the long sides as they are upwards, that is more complicated and makes process difficult.
- start with all pieces sorted and lying flat.
- look carefully at the long sides, they come in two pairs, put them aside together.
- work near a clean wall so you can push the box agains the wall to snap sides in place , wall will be your assistant, a second person..
START with a long flat side.. on the floor.. snap the bottom at the end of it.
Then snap the opposite side on it.. but beware the pairs of long walls with the same
interior pattern need to face each other. So now put them on the opposite side,
you will need to figure out which sides to put in first as the other two have to
cover the first pair. snap them on..

Now just add the lid and you are done.
customerImages.title: IMPORTANT! COLOR+ LOCK THAT IT COMES WITH +  BACK  IS DIFFERENT THEN FRONT+ SUPER EASY ASSEMBLY

customerImages.text:
As you may see from the first attached photo, the casting that makes up the top of this item arrived with a WICKED curve in it. While that did not prevent assembly of the product, the lid did not lie flat on the body of the container. Result: an atrocious appearance, especially for an item that is supposed to beautify your patio by hiding unsightly trash bags/containers. This reflects both a failure in manufacturing and the absence of subsequent quality control measures.

Similarly, the second attached photo shows the hatch (which is a part of the lid) and its latching mechanism. The latch does not work correctly, because once again the casting is crooked, and because quality-control at Suncast entirely missed the problem and packaged this "horror show" for shipping to Amazon and for eventual retail sale.

VERY DISAPPOINTING -- I have other Suncast products, and the fit-and-finish on these are just fine.
customerImages.title: Poor Manufacturing; No Evidence of Quality Control

customerImages.text: I bought this trash can because my dog uses puppy pads and they can get to smelling something awful. I saw a review that said it would contain that smell however I was really skeptical.  When I first saw it in the flat pack, I was really disappointed, it looked so much smaller than I expected but I was completely wrong.  The 33 gallon bag fits in there perfectly and it held 2 weeks of trash.  This thing looks small but it is deceiving, it still wasn’t full after two weeks.  I think it would have held almost 3 weeks of all my trash. (3 tall kitchen bags full).  I know that the compact aspect of it is amazing but it doesn’t hold a candle to the containment of the smell.  It sits in the sun till noon and walking past I still smelled nothing.  I don’t know how it does it but it’s true.  It was easy for me to put together by myself and needed no tools.  The lid is easy to operate it opens two ways one to put trash in )like a little window) and then the whole lid lifts up to take the trash out.  That way the bag never slips.  This is the most amazing trash can I’ve come across in 54 years and I think it will outlast me lol.  I would definitely recommend it.
customerImages.title: Can’t even smell the dog poop!!!

how sad Suncast has developed a product that does not meet the product description.

customerImages.text: I had this model for years and finally the top lid broke off at the hinge so there was no more odor control.  This one had to be put together, but there aren't any strength or integrity issues.  The swing-up lid fits onto the back with hinges, which is nice.  Only difference I noticed was in moving the container; the lid lifts up easily, so you're left having to lift it by the base and there aren't any handles.
customerImages.title: Trash receptacle that's worth the money!

customerImages.text: I needed a "nice" trash bin for my patio. This would be ideal, if a little overpriced, if the company stood behind it's product. We put the first one together and the lid was warped and doesn't close properly. There is an insert in the shipping box that states call us first if there is a problem, before returning the item. So I called, they did nothing. I had to ship it back and I requested another one. Here's the kicker, second one has the SAME ISSUE. I paid $50 for a trash can that's warped and won't close properly. Do not recommend.
customerImages.title: Poor quality control, customer service useless

I’m using it for an indoor trash can cause I’ve got big dogs who like to get into the smaller normal trash cans and pull stuff out at night 🤦🏻‍♀️. Love this trash can! I bought some 33 gallon trash bags on amazon too from hefty and it’s perfect! My dogs (a rot and a pit so pretty big dogs) heads do not come up as high as this thing! It’s huge too so less trips to the outdoor can :D got the brown one and it looks great ! Would definitely recommend to anyone !

customerImages.text: I’ve had this in my cart for quite awhile and finally bought it to go on my back porch. It was easy enough to put together, seeing how everything is suppose to snap together. However, not everything snaps together....if they send you completely warped pieces. As you can see in my photos, the left side bows outward, which will not allow it to line up with the groove in the lid. The front piece, bows inward, leaving a massive gap between the lid connector, which is what holds the lid on the container. Very disappointed. I will be sending it back, to get a refund and looking for another brand.
customerImages.title: Probably would be good but they send jacked up pieces and expect you to make it work. 😡

It is not worth $50

customerImages.text: My man put this together for me. It didn’t take him long @ all & he said it was easy. It’s sturdy & love how the cover has a separate part that lifts up that keeps the trash bag in place. Then the little top cover is what opens up to put your trash in it. I also realized that the little tab you use to pull the cover up can actually lock to help keep the cover down. It’s a good size & I’m using it outside in my backyard for my trash from grilling/eating on the patio. Great price I paid since I’ve seen other’s reviews who have paid more $$$ for it.
customerImages.title: Great trash can!

customerImages.text: I bought this to use on my small apartment deck as a laundry basket. My washer and dryer are in a tiny storage shed outside my 2nd floor apartment off of the deck. I have struggled with the inconvenience of not having a place to sort and organize my laundry near my washer, as I’m not allowed to have “tacky” plastic laundry baskets sitting outside. So with a cloth liner these make awesome, tidy laundry bins. Very easy to pop together and sturdy enough to hold 2-3 medium loads of laundry. I love the little slider that locks the bin lid into place, so convenient! My landlord loves them too and I won’t get any complaints from the community about my laundry😊
customerImages.title: These are awesome as laundry bins!

customerImages.text: We have been using this bin as a staging container for our commingled recyclables. The benefit is that we can keep a much smaller recycling container in the kitchen which we can empty as needed into this large bin.  The Suncast bin is attractive and looks great on our lighter color deck.  The top has a locking mechanism that simply slides in to lock but this does not provide any kind of "click" or feedback that it is securely locked into place.  However, we have not had any issues with any animal tampering.  The item arrived unassembled. Assembly was very easy but it must be done in the order indicated in the instructions since some panels have grooves which are inaccessible once other pieces are snapped in place (leaving no gap for the next panel to be inserted).  So long as you snap the pieces in the correct order, this easily assembles in just a few minutes.  You're left with a very sturdy and handsome resin container that has the appearance of wood and wicker.  One word of caution: This bin should only be used with durable trash bags as the interior walls have many hard edges due to the structural plastic interior.  I have attached a close up photo of the interior ridges I am referring to.  I haven't had problems getting the bags out of the bin but thinner bags will have small snag holes and if the bag gets too full, I imagine this could very easily become problematic as it may cause a large tear as you attempt to pull the bag from the bin.  Do not let this deter you however.  These interior ridges allow the unit to be very sturdy without adding much weight.  As far as using a trash bag, this involves popping open the main door on top, inserting a bag and wrapping the opening over the top edges before you close and press the top until snapped into place.  This seems to hold the bag and we've had no issues with the bag dropping out or coming free until full.  Reverse the process to remove the bag and put a fresh bag in.  If I have any issues, I'll be sure to come back here and post an update.
customerImages.title: We've found it useful for staging our trash and recycling

customerImages.text:
Solution to torn bags that catch on the rough-sided interior! Order a box of Northern Bathroom Tissue (https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01B5KAAUS/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o03_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1), which is actually really nice TP, and get the added bonus of the carton fitting perfectly into this Suncast Trash Hideaway to work as a liner. Carefully open the Northern TP carton, from the top and bottom, keeping the rest intact. Cut off about 2" from the top flaps. Re-fold the carton so that the sides are all 13x13x13x13. And voila! A perfect fit and your bags will now slide smoothly out of the trash bin. I added a little reinforcement-by-duct-tape on the flaps to prevent them from folding in, but that's it!

This item would have gotten 5 stars had the interior walls been smooth or otherwise not designed to tear holes in the full bags when trying to remove them. Otherwise it's a great trash bin for the money.
customerImages.title: See review for solution to ripped trash bags!

customerImages.text: I think the color is a little darker than the image shows, but it's still a nice dark chocolate that will look nice anywhere. It is a GREAT size. I use it in my kitchen because I don't like to take out the trash every day like with 13 gallon bins. The lid is great and keeps anything from ever smelling. Thanks to one of the other reviewers tips, when I first received it I took the cardboard box it came in apart and lined the inside of the bin with cardboard, and duct taped the ends together so it will stay in place. The reason for this is that the way that the pieces of the bin are made, there are plastic lines inside each side on the inside, and it could rip the trash bag if it gets too full. So you just cut the cardboard box it came in open, and fold it to fit in the bin, then duct tape the ends together and cut it so it's shorter than the lid. You never see the cardboard unless you take out the trash bag, and even then it just looks like solid cardboard inner walls so no big deal. Also it was easy to put together when I first received it. I am a small 23 year old woman and I put it together and lined it with cardboard in less than an hour the day it arrived. I have now had it for at least 6 months and I still am happy with it.

one.text: We've had this trash hideaway for a couple of months.  I waited to be sure how things would work before posting a review.Pros:- We like the design and look for use on our patio.  For the price, it is fine and much like we anticipated.- The latching feature is functional and needed for our use.- It was easy to assemble and the resin construction should hold up well outside.Cons:- The trash bag will rip ... plain and simple.  I read the other reviews before ordering and thought we'll just be careful.  If you are actually putting trash into this container (duh), it is going to expand enough that the inside ribs will catch it and tear it.  I had read Marty B's review about using a 14x14x14 carboard box as a liner.  Bought one at our local blue discount store for cheap, but really?!?!?  There is no way I can give more than one star when a manufacturer ignores so many complaints about a design defect.  Heck, if they don't want to redesign, they could add a fold-out plastic liner to insert after assembly.
one.title: So Aggravating - Design Defect

one.text: I like the size of the container.  I just naturally assumed when I snapped it together that the top would stay closed, not really an above-and-beyond expectation!  When fully assembled the top had to be slammed down to the closed position, but then would pop back up.  I had to fabricate a latch which would hold it closed - not something covered in the ’scarce’ instructions. I only kept it because it is the size I need, but found after several uses that the inside walls were not smooth and I could not extract a full plastic bag liner.  This is the WORST item I have ever purchased from Amazon.  I want my money back!

I’ve even went as far as not filling the trash bag up so much thinking maybe it would not catch on the plastic inside but it still did. So if you don’t mind picking trash up every time you change the bag in the can then go ahead and get one but if you don’t want to pick your trash up u already threw away then don’t waste your money on this trash can. In other areas,  I've cut pieces of cardboard and hot-glued them.As I said, looks great, but wouldn't buy again. Very disappointed.

one.text: There is a piece of plastic that sticks out into the bag area. It snags the bag every single time you try to remove the bag. I say “try”because if you’ve stuffed the bag even a little, then you might not get the bag out unless you a) rip it to pieces and then clean up the mess. Or b) you manually pull the garbage out and put it in another bag.I cannot believe that the manufacturer would sell such a defective product. They didn’t test it? It would be a simple modification to bevel that area so it doesn’t snag. The protrusion doesn’t appear to perform any function other than maybe adding some thickness for strength, but they could still do that and bevel the end so that the bag slides over it rather than catching on the squared off end. It’s like you drove a nail into your garbage can and expected it not to catch and tear the bags. Outrageous. It’s the worst designed product I’ve seen in a long time and I buy a lot of stuff.
one.title: Horribly frustrating design defect!

one.text: As you may see from the first attached photo, the casting that makes up the top of this item arrived with a WICKED curve in it.  While that did not prevent assembly of the product, the lid did not lie flat on the body of the container.  Result: an atrocious appearance, especially for an item that is supposed to beautify your patio by hiding unsightly trash bags/containers.  This reflects both a failure in manufacturing and the absence of subsequent quality control measures. Similarly, the second attached photo shows the hatch (which is a part of the lid) and its latching mechanism.  The latch does not work correctly, because once again the casting is crooked, and because quality-control at Suncast entirely missed the problem and packaged this "horror show" for shipping to Amazon and for eventual retail sale.VERY DISAPPOINTING -- I have other Suncast products, and the fit-and-finish on these are just fine.
one.title: Poor Manufacturing; No Evidence of Quality Control

one.text: No directions included. "START WITH THE BOTTOM or buy some Gorilla Glue."Dear Suncast:Thinking about posting my review on Amazon.Decided to give you a heads up.It's Friday, 04/30/2021. I'll wait until 05/21/2021 before I post this review. I'd like to hear what you think.(1)"Before you begin...read instructions prior to assembly." (2)"This kit contains parts that can be damaged if incorrectly assembled." (3)"Suncast is not responsible for replacing parts lost or damaged due to incorrect assembly." And my favorite: (4)"Please follow instructions."Problem: THERE WERE NO INSTRUCTIONS in or on the shipping box or attached to any of the labeled and unlabeled parts.A search on Amazon (You can find it between “PRODUCT INFORMATION” and "VIDEOS”), provides valuable links to two PDFs: "User Manual" and "Product Documentation." Both mention the above points.If only Suncast could tell me how I can attach the bottom of my "Suncast 33 Gallon Hideaway Can Resin Outdoor Trash with Lid Use in Backyard, Deck, or Patio…," it could serve its purpose well; if not, the bottom and the trash bag w/ its weekly collection of dog waste material will drop out.I wonder if the two recently-drilled holes in the bottom and back panel (I didn't drill them) hold the key to a possible solution? If nothing else, maybe I can use a zip tie and… I better check the User Manual and Product Information links again to be sure. But first I'll contact Suncast and get their take on my problem.It's Friday, 04/30/2021. I'll wait until 05/21/2021 before I post this review.Saturday, 05/22/2021. No response from Suncast. Review submitted to Amazon.
one.title: If no directions are included. CAUTION: "START WITH THE BOTTOM or buy some Gorilla Glue."

The can is so big that it should be able to hold quite a bit. I only got them so I dont have to keep lugging paper plates and lunch trash in and out of my house with 2 babies (I dont have a nice sliding glass door to a patio right there waiting for me)... So we change the bag weekly before garbage day. I hate wasting a huge garbage bag on on having to take out trash that is 1/4 full but we do because its mostly from just lunchtime throughout the week. But from even just that little bit, we have had such a major maggot problem.  These containers dont have a good enough seal on them to keep bugs out. Its sooooooo frustrating.I am hoping the bottles/cans one is ok but I am not holding my breath because inside I see some fruit flies when I open the lid.People joke and call me OCD, I am a very clean person and am constantly sweeping my patio off in and around my table and the cans so Its not user error. (And I always keep them "locked"... which just just. Very loose slide of the plastic lid handle).These are really only good for single use trash collection like at parties and raking the bag out the same day.Doesnt cut it for me and I am super disappointed because they LOOK nice and they arent the cheapest things in the world.
two.title: Maggots Galore! Doesnt seal well.

Sadly, it’s almost impossible to take apart to return or I would have. We will fill it with garbage and throw the entire thing out with the trash. Total waste of time, energy and money. questions.answer: Very good question.  Opening the top is critical to usage of this unit.  There are three ways of doing this:  1) To open the entire top (to load or unload a trash bag), hold on to the can's body while pulling up on the very edge of the lip of the lid.  The whole top will swing up.  2) To open the top's hatch (normal use/disposing of trash), find the tab on the hatch lid (about an inch behind the lip).  Pull the tab towards yourself to unlock the hatch; you can then open the hatch.  I recommend locking the hatch after closing it to prevent odor issues.  3) If none of the above work, use a crowbar. Note that I do *not* recommend this.

questions.answer: NOT WICKER!!  Someone answered this question by replying that the item is made out of "wicker".  It is absolutely NOT made out of wicker.  It is a heavy duty resin product.  We purchased one in April, 2013 and another one, in the lighter color in 2018, because it was a better color match for our patio.  Both have been subjected to the Arizona sun, rain, haboobs and every other weather condition with the exception of snow (although they sit on a patio in freezing temperatures).  It probably would not hold a large amount of water because it is not a solid piece of resin, and fits together like a puzzle that you have to (easily) assemble.    Please see my photo of the product, along with a review, under the name of "Jen".  The 1st trash bin purchased, dark brown in color, now sits in a garage corner and is used to store small garden tools.  When hosed off both of these bins look like new.  I am not employed by this company and nobody paid me in exchange for good reviews.  When I find a good product for a good price, which seems rare these days, I like to acknowledge it.
